Uses of FlxPoint in org.flixel
 

Subclasses of FlxPoint in org.flixel
 class FlxButton
          A simple button class that calls a function when clicked by the mouse.
 class FlxEmitter
          FlxEmitter is a lightweight particle emitter.
 class FlxGroup
          This is an organizational class that can update and render a bunch of FlxObjects.
 class FlxObject
          This is the base class for most of the display objects (FlxSprite, FlxText, etc).
 class FlxQuadTree
          A fairly generic quad tree structure for rapid overlap checks.
 class FlxRect
          Stores a rectangle.
 class FlxSound
          This is the universal flixel sound object, used for streaming, music, and sound effects.
 class FlxSprite
          The main "game object" class, handles basic physics and animation.
 class FlxText
          Extends FlxSprite to support rendering text.
 class FlxTileblock
          This is the basic "environment object" class, used to create simple walls and floors.
 class FlxTilemap
          This is a traditional tilemap display and collision class.
 

Fields in org.flixel declared as FlxPoint
 FlxPoint FlxObject.acceleration
          How fast the speed of this object is changing.
 FlxPoint FlxObject.colVector
          These store a couple of useful numbers for speeding up collision resolution.
 FlxPoint FlxObject.drag
          This isn't drag exactly, more like deceleration that is only applied when acceleration is not affecting the sprite.
 FlxPoint FlxEmitter.maxParticleSpeed
          The maximum possible velocity of a particle.
 FlxPoint FlxObject.maxVelocity
          If you are using acceleration, you can use maxVelocity with it to cap the speed automatically (very useful!).
 FlxPoint FlxEmitter.minParticleSpeed
          The minimum possible velocity of a particle.
 FlxPoint FlxSprite.offset
          If you changed the size of your sprite object to shrink the bounding box, you might need to offset the new bounding box from the top-left corner of the sprite.
 FlxPoint FlxObject.origin
          WARNING: The origin of the sprite will default to its center.
 FlxPoint FlxEmitter.particleDrag
          The X and Y drag component of particles launched from the emitter.
 FlxPoint FlxSprite.scale
          Change the size of your sprite's graphic.
 FlxPoint FlxObject.scrollFactor
          A point that can store numbers from 0 to 1 (for X and Y independently) that governs how much this object is affected by the camera subsystem. 0 means it never moves, like a HUD element or far background graphic. 1 means it scrolls along a the same speed as the foreground layer.
 FlxPoint FlxObject.velocity
          The basic speed of this object.
